title: Stop gimping tank runes
body:

Not in the early game. Iron Skin and Mirror Shell are not runes meant for tanks to ever get. Tanks don't have a choice of which rune to take in that slot - Conditioning is the only one that benefits them.

Only a few tanks can get the 5% boost after healing outside of potions (in lane - Warmog's obviously helps later).

Yeah, that's why I specified in lane - most tanks can't get it during laning phase. Which is the phase where these runes are meant to help you...

My personal feelings on it are: If you are going Resolve as your primary path, there is no reason whatsoever to take Iron Skin or Mirror Shell. If you are going Resolve as your secondary path, you might only be there to help with the early game, so they may be options - and you're more likely to have a built-in heal or build lifesteal that would trigger the 5% boost.

I think if you're taking Resolve as your secondary and you're looking for something to help you through the lane phase there's better choices in other tiers.

Perseverance is probably going to save your arse more than any other mastery in the game and it's going to have a far bigger impact than Iron Skin in almost every case. You need 150 armour for 1 stack of Perseverance to be better only considering armour, but that's not where it shines, even in this case however it's still probably statistically better since you get some MR too. At two stacks it's better at 34 armour, so always. The best thing though is the tenacity you get for using a summoner, which will save you a lot more than a few points of armour anyway. This mastery is the reason you'd offspec into resolve for most champions.

After that there's second wind, which is going to give you far more anti harass than 3 armour. Let's say you get hit to half HP and you have 800 HP. This mastery would regen you by 16 HP meaning for 3 armour to save you that much HP you'd have to take 788 damage assuming you had 20 base armour. It gets worse as your armour gets higher. Mini D-Shield just saves you more HP at all but very high HP values.
Just goes to show how crappy Iron Skin and Mirror Shell are that even _Second Wind_, which is a pretty crappy rune, itself, is pretty clearly superior...

I actually think Second Wind's pretty solid, it's not the best rune by a long shot but it still beats out most of the Resolve tree quite handily and is even fairly average when compared across trees.

The only other non-keystone runes in resolve which seem stronger to me are Font, Perseverance and conditionally Overgrowth.

Second Wind would be decent if it weren't completely gated by the "for 10 seconds after being damaged by an enemy champion" condition. With it's current numbers and effects, it's just a crappy version of the current Perseverance Mastery (+50% health regen, increased to +200% health regen when below 25% health). If it gave some other effect during those 10 seconds, or gave a weaker, persistent effect outside of the 10 seconds, it would be a decent rune.

As it is right now, the healing is way too low. It's only noticeable when you're almost dead and don't want to be taking damage, anyways, and it won't help you at that point, since you're an easy kill. It can be decent for tanks in the late game - 12 health per second when you're down 3k in a teamfight is pretty good - but it's terrible in lane.

>Second Wind would be decent if it weren't completely gated by the "for 10 seconds after being damaged by an enemy champion" condition

It's heal over 10 seconds, my understanding is that the healing starts immediately. So if you're AAd by a Jayce then 2.5 seconds later he AAs you again you'd heal 1% of your missing HP over the first 2.5 seconds then it would be overwritten and you'd heal for 4% of your new missing HP value.

What i find worse is that all 3 keystones in the TANK tree focus on damage, graso mostly is for the damage procs cause for some reason it's 3%hp as damage and only 1,5 as healing, demolish is damage only, and aftershock whie atleast giveing solid defense also focuses more on the aoe damage.
It's wiered that there is no really defensive focused keaystone in that tree, but the dps tree has one...which scales off of stats and thus is not great on tanky champs.

Demolish isn't a keystone.

The 3 tank keystones are Grasp, GUARDIAN, and Aftershock.   Guardian is a purely defensive keystone, where you can channel on an ally and if they would take damage, you and they gain a short shield that is applied before the damage is taken, with a 60 second CD.   If the proc isn't consumed at all, it instead goes on a 6 second CD.


Also, something you haven't really noticed on Grasp, every time you proc it you gain a max hp bonus.   If you proc it a ton, you can easily gain several hundred HP, as it gives +5 max hp per proc on melees.   You can theoretically proc it a max of 15 times per minute in laning phase.  If you assume 10 minutes of procs, it is 750 hp.  So assuming a safe bet of 1/3rd or 1/4th proc of that, you'd be able to push for a solid 200-250 hp by the end of laning phase as a permanent bonus.


Grasp is pushing you to be very aggressive in top lane, I'll say that much, as every time you proc it it is increasing your total power.

That's not a safe bet for a melee top lane tank. A safe bet would be them proccing Grasp 2-4 times per minute for 100-200 health at the end of laning phase. Between recalling, your opponent recalling, TP plays on either side, and your general lack of range and mobility, you aren't likely to get more than that while actually farming and not getting murdered for going too ham and inviting the enemy jungler to gank you.
